DataElement.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy Staging Complete Timepoint Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response as to whether the patient meets the eligibility criteria for clinical trial participation with regards to the timepoint of completion for a staging sentinel node biopsy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy Staging Complete Timepoint Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer._Performing exams and tests to learn the extent of the cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body. It is important to know the stage of the disease in order to plan the best treatment._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.:Performing exams and tests to learn the extent of the cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body. It is important to know the stage of the disease in order to plan the best treatment.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.
The process of defining at what point in the natural history of a malignant disease a patient is when a diagnosis is made.

Property.preferredName: Complete Timepoint Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria

The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ValueDomain.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form

ReferenceDocuments.name: Staging sentinel node biopsy,
ReferenceDocuments.description: Staging sentinel node biopsy, must be completed within 120 days of the original diagnosis

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Surgery (which refers to the staging sentinel node biopsy and wide local excision as these are both to be done on the same day) must be completed within 120 days of the original diagnosis and within 28 days of randomization
